text:
Malik Ata Muhammad Khan (Urdu, 25 October 1941 – 6 February 2020), popularly known as Prince Malik Ata was a Pakistani feudal lord and politician. He was born in British India. Khan was a member of the Provincial Assembly of the Punjab from 1990 to 1993. He was President of the Equestrian Federation from 1982 until his death and Vice President of the International Tent Pegging Federation from 2013 until his death.
Khan died on 6 February 2020 in Attock, Pakistan at the age of 78.
